Eterna

Multipurpose bootstrap site template

  • created: 07/15/2013
  • latest update: 07/15/2013
  • by: iwebstudio
  • email: info@iweb-studio.com

General

Eterna is a clean modern HTML site template built with responsive Twitter bootstrap. Please remember, it's HTML CSS site template so you need to edit with any HTML editor to customize text or content. This template coming with "Boxed" and "Wide (default)" layout and has 5 pre-made template accent colors as you can see on folder 'color'. We've separated each accent color to a single css file to make you easy to edit template color without touching other css files.

You can go to http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/ if you want to learn more about twitter boostrap since this is the main css framework of Eterna template.

Again, since it's HTML CSS based you can edit all text, content with HTML editor like notepad++ or anykind else. Quite easy for people with basic HTML-CSS knowledge :)

CSS files

All CSS files stored in folder 'css' and there is one folder 'color' for all template color (5 colors).

All orange(default) color as seen on the template configured in color/default.css

list of css files used in Eterna template in folder 'css'

  • animate.css
  • bootstrap.css
  • bootstrap-responsive.css
  • font-awesome.css
  • camera.css
  • jquery.bxslider.css
  • shortcodes.css
  • overwrite.css
  • cslider.css
  • flexslider.css
  • style.css --> Main template style

Javascript

Below are all javascript plugin script used by Eterna template, all stored in 'js' folder

 

  • bootstrap.js
  • jquery
  • Fancyboxlightbox plugin
  • Google prettycode script
  • jQuery easing script
  • jQuery parallax content slider
  • jQuery quicksand for portfolio filter
  • animate.js
  • modernizr
  • flexslider
  • bxslider script
  • jQuery inview
  • camera slider script
  • jquery validation

Basic setting

Use "boxed" or "wide" layout

By default all HTML files in Eterna are using "wide/stretched" layout. It's very easy if you want to use "boxed" wapper layout.

- Just add "boxed" class in wrapper div, that's it!

see example code below:

 

 

Use background pattern images or customize body background (applied on boxed mode)

When you use boxed wrapper, you'll be able to show your body backgound. We've included 10 repeatable background images in folder 'img/bodybg' that can be used as body background.

Currently each body background called by single css file, see in folder 'bodybg' there are 10 css files from bg1.css.... to bg10.css

see css code example (from bg1.css) which call "bg1.png" as body background

body {
    background-image: url(../img/bodybg/bg1.png);
    background-repeat: repeat;
}
 
say you want to use bg1.jpg pattern image as body background, so just call the bg1.css from your HTML file and put before </head> tag
 
    <!-- boxed bg -->
    <link id="bodybg" href="boxedbg/bg1.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" />
 
If you don't want to use this way and has HTML-CSS knowledge you can also edit from 'style.css' directly, find "body" tag and put background value
 
body {
    font-family:'Open Sans', Arial, sans-serif;
    font-size:13px;
    line-height:1.6em;
    color:#656565;
   <!-- your body background -->
    background-image: url(../img/bodybg/bg1.jpg);
    background-repeat: repeat;
}
 

 

Use premade template color

Eterna has 5 premade accent colors that can be found in folder 'color', by default each HTML file uses 'default.css' (orange color).

if you want to use other color, just open your html file and  find following code (on line 18-19)

 

    <!-- Theme skin -->
    <link href="color/default.css" rel="stylesheet" />
 
just change 'default.css' above with other available color e.g 'blue.css', 'yellow.css'..so on from folder 'color'
 

Template font / typography

This template using main font from Google webfont

1. Open sans (Body and heading)

Both font above imported via "style.css" on line 1-2

 

/* ==== Google font ==== */
@import url('http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Open+Sans:300,400,600,700');
 

 

Upload template to your hosting

After you've done with content editing, you can just upload all files & folders directly with FTP to your hosting root directory. If you're very new with FTP you can learn from  http://wiki.filezilla-project.org/Using

 

 
 
 
 
 

Components

Buttons

All available buttons demonstrate on "components.html" file, you can copy the source code of desired button and use on other pages

 

Icons

We use font-awesome font icon for all Eterna icons, all available icons demonstrate on "icons.html" page and we've built some icon variations to make rounded,circled and square icons on "icons-variations.html" page

You can read more information about font-awesome icons from http://fortawesome.github.io/Font-Awesome/

 

We've also demonstrated more available components on "components.html" page, basically all components from Twitter bootstrap framework.

maybe we didn't put or demonstrate all bootstrap components there but we're pretty sure if you can add any bootstrap components code to the template easily without any editing on css or js file, just put the HTML code of the component.

Go to http://twitter.github.io/bootstrap/ to get any HTML code of your desired component

 

 

Element settings

Camera slider

Used on index.html, index-alt2.html and index-alt3.html

all slider images on index-alt4.html stored in folder 'img/slides/camera'. You can overwrite example images with your own images, for easiest way just use same name, image format and size so you don't need to edit the HTML

 

HTML code of the camera slider (example from index.html)  :

            <!-- slideshow start here -->

                <div class="camera_wrap" id="camera-slide">
                
                    <!-- slide 1 here -->
                    <div  data-src="img/slides/camera/slide1/img1.jpg">
                        <div class="camera_caption fadeFromLeft">
                            <div class="container">
                                <div class="row">                                
                                    <div class="span6">
                                        <h2 class="animated fadeInDown"><strong>Great template for <span class="colored">multi usage</span></strong></h2>
                                        <p class="animated fadeInUp"> Vim porro dicam reprehendunt te, populo quodsi dissentiet cum ad. Ne natum deseruisse vis. Iisque deseruisse sententiae mel ne, dolores appetere vim ut. Sea no tamquam reprimique.</p>
                                        <a href="#" class="btn btn-success btn-large animated fadeInUp">
                                            <i class="icon-link"></i> Read more
                                        </a>
                                        <a href="#" class="btn btn-theme btn-large animated fadeInUp">
                                            <i class="icon-download"></i> Download
                                        </a>

                                        <p class="animated fadeInUp">Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada</p>
                                        <img src="img/slides/camera/slide3/browsers.png" alt="" class="animated bounceInDown delay1" />

                                </div>  
                            </div>                                                                                         
                        </div>
                    </div>

                </div>

            <!-- slideshow end here -->

There are 2 javascript files needed for camera slider that can be found in folder 'js/camera'

1. camera.js  --> Camera slider script

2. setting.js  --> jQuery function to run camera slider

You may set or change current parameters in setting.js file e.g slider speed, hover ..etc

/*global jQuery:false */
jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
"use strict";
    //Camera Jquery
    $('#camera-slide').camera({        
        thumbnails: false,
        hover: false,
        fx: 'random',
        time: 7000,
        transPeriod: 1500,
        pagination: false,
        loader: 'none'
    });
});

For more detailed information regarding camera slider you can go to http://www.pixedelic.com/plugins/camera/

 

 

Parallax content slider

used on index-alt4.html

all slider images on index-alt4.html stored in folder 'img/slides/parallax'. You can overwrite example images with your own images, for easiest way just use same name, image format and size so you don't need to edit the HTML

the javascript function for parallax content slider written on very bottom of index-alt4.html code :

1
2
3
4
5
<script>
    $(function() {
        $('#da-slider').cslider();
    });
</script>

This slider coming from codrops tutorial, you can read more detailed information about this slider on http://tympanus.net/codrops/2012/03/15/parallax-content-slider-with-css3-and-jquery/

 

Twitter feed widget (on footer widget)

Please note that besides setting the feed details in JS you must also configure it in PHP. See PHP configuration in section below.
Open "custom.js" file which you'll find in the JS directory. On line #137 there's a piece of code that contains "username: 'wrapbootstrap',". Simply replace "wrapbootstrap" with the Twitter username whose tweets you want to show and you're done! Don't forget the single quotes around the username.

        // twitter feed
        $(".twitter").tweet({
            join_text: "auto",
            username: "wrapbootstrap",
            avatar_size: 20,
            count: 1,
            auto_join_text_default: "we said,",
            auto_join_text_ed: "we",
            auto_join_text_ing: "we were",
            auto_join_text_reply: "we replied",
            auto_join_text_url: "we were checking out",
            loading_text: "loading tweets..."
        });

Due to new Twitter API rules you have to create an application in order to show custom Twitter feeds. The process is very simple and free. Go to dev.twitter.com and login with your Twitter account (any account will do). Click "My applications" under your account's avatar and then click "Create a new application". Application details are really not important, just fill them in. After the app is created click "Create my access token" (blue button on the page bottom). Then open tweet.php found in the site's root folder and copy/paste 4 strings in appropriate variables. Please mind the single quotes; they have to be around the string.

Contact form

There are 2 PHP files stored in 'contact' folder.  Both files used for the working contact form on contact.html page. To make the contact form work properly you'll be required to edit config.php and place your email address in the place of the default value: "name@email.com". That's all needed to run the contact form

  1. config.php
  2. contact.php
